en: His hand shook, and the candle fell from its socket on the floor and lay there sputtering. He placed his foot on it and put it out. Then he flung himself into the rickety chair that was standing by the table and buried his face in his hands.
vi: Tay y run, cây nến rơi từ đế xuống sàn, nằm đó kêu xèo xèo. Y đặt chân lên nó và dập tắt nó. Sau đó y buông mình xuống cái ghế lung lay để bên bàn và vùi mặt vào tay.
tr: Hallward’ın elleri titremeye başlamıştı; şamdandaki mum yere düştü ve orada cızırdamaya başladı. Ressam ayağıyla basıp mumu söndürdü. Sonra masa başında duran dingildeyen sandalyeye kendini bırakarak yüzünü ellerine gömdü.
es: Le tembló la mano; la vela cayó de la palmatoria al suelo y empezó a chisporrotear. Hallward la apagó con el pie. Luego se dejó caer en la desvencijada silla cercana a la mesa y escondió el rostro entre las manos.
vi_translation: With a swift motion, the candle fell from its holder to the floor, lying there with a sizzle. He stepped on it and extinguished it. Then he let himself fall into the wobbly chair next to the table and buried his face in his hands.
tr_translation: Hallward's hands began to tremble; the candle on the candelabrum fell to the ground and started to sizzle there. The painter stepped on the candle with his foot and extinguished it. Then, dropping himself into the wobbling chair by the table, he buried his face in his hands.
es_translation: His hand trembled; the candle fell from the candlestick to the floor and began to sputter. Hallward extinguished it with his foot. Then he let himself fall into the rickety chair near the table and hid his face in his hands.

en: He could hear nothing, but the drip, drip on the threadbare carpet. He opened the door and went out on the landing. The house was absolutely quiet. No one was about. For a few seconds he stood bending over the balustrade and peering down into the black seething well of darkness. Then he took out the key and returned to the room, locking himself in as he did so.
vi: Cậu không thể nghe được gì ngoài tiếng chảy nhỏ giọt, nhỏ giọt lên tấm thảm mòn xơ chỉ. Cậu mở cửa và ra ngoài đầu cầu thang. Ngôi nhà lặng ngắt như tờ. Không một ai chung quanh. Cậu đứng vài giây, cúi người qua lan can, đăm đắm nhìn xuống cái giếng đen sục sôi của bóng tối. Sau đó cậu lấy chìa ra và quay lại phòng, nhốt mình vào trong.
tr: Eski püskü halının üstüne düşen damlaların pıtırtısından başka bir şey duymuyordu. Kapıyı açtı, sahanlığa çıktı. Evin içinde hiçbir ses, hiçbir ayak kıpırtısı yoktu. Dorian parmaklıktan eğilip aşağıdaki kaynaşan karanlık kuyuya baktı. Sonra anahtarını çıkarıp gene odaya girdi, kapıyı içerden kilitledi.
es: Sólo se oía el golpear de las gotas de sangre que caían sobre la raída alfombra. Abrió la puerta y salió al descansillo. La casa estaba en absoluto silencio. Nadie se había levantado. Durante unos segundos permaneció inclinado sobre la barandilla, intentando penetrar con la mirada el negro pozo de atormentada oscuridad. Luego se sacó la llave del bolsillo y regresó a la habitación del retrato, encerrándose dentro.
vi_translation: You can't hear anything except the dripping sound, dripping onto the worn-out carpet. You open the door and step out onto the landing. The house is as silent as a sheet. Not a single person around. You stand for a few seconds, leaning over the railing, staring down into the boiling black well of darkness. Then you take out the key and return to the room, locking yourself inside.
tr_translation: He heard nothing but the patter of drops falling on the shabby carpet. He opened the door and stepped out onto the landing. There was no sound, no movement of feet inside the house. Dorian leaned over the railing and looked down into the seething dark pit below. Then he took out his key, re-entered the room, and locked the door from the inside.
es_translation: Only the sound of blood drops hitting the worn-out carpet could be heard. He opened the door and stepped out onto the landing. The house was in absolute silence. No one had gotten up. For a few seconds, he remained leaning over the railing, trying to pierce the black well of tormented darkness with his gaze. Then he took the key out of his pocket and returned to the portrait room, locking himself inside.

en: Having reached the door, he turned the key and opened it. He did not even glance at the murdered man. He felt that the secret of the whole thing was not to realize the situation. The friend who had painted the fatal portrait to which all his misery had been due had gone out of his life. That was enough.
vi: Đến cửa rồi, cậu xoay chìa, mở nó ra. Cậu thậm chí không để mắt đến người bị giết. Cậu cảm thấy rằng bí mật của cả chuyện này là không nhận thức được tình cảnh. Người bạn đã vẽ bức chân dung tai hại mà mọi nỗi khổ của cậu là do nó ra, đã biến khỏi đời cậu. Thế là đủ.
tr: Yürüdü, anahtarı çevirip oda kapısını açtı. Öldürmüş olduğu adama bakmadı bile. Bu durumun püf noktasının, olayların bilincine varmamak olduğunu hissediyordu. Çektiği bütün acıların kaynağı olan o uğursuz portreyi çizen dost, hayatından çıkıp gitmişti. Bu kadarı yeterliydi.
es: Al llegar a la puerta hizo girar la llave y la abrió. Ni siquiera se volvió para lanzar una ojeada al cadáver. Comprendía que el secreto del éxito consistía en no darse cuenta de lo sucedido. El amigo que había pintado el retrato fatal, causante de todos sus sufrimientos, había desaparecido de su vida. Eso era suficiente.
vi_translation: Reaching the door, he turned the key and opened it. He didn't even glance at the person who had been killed. He felt that the secret to the whole affair was not being aware of the situation. The friend who had painted the disastrous portrait, which was the cause of all his suffering, had vanished from his life. That was enough.
tr_translation: He walked, turned the key, and opened the room door. He didn't even look at the man he had killed. He felt that the key to this situation was not becoming aware of the events. The friend who had drawn that cursed portrait, the source of all his suffering, had left his life. This was enough.
es_translation: Upon reaching the door, he turned the key and opened it. He didn't even turn around to glance at the corpse. He understood that the secret of success was to not acknowledge what had happened. The friend who had painted the fateful portrait, the cause of all his suffering, had disappeared from his life. That was enough.

en: When he reached the library, he saw the bag and coat in the corner. They must be hidden away somewhere. He unlocked a secret press that was in the wainscoting, a press in which he kept his own curious disguises, and put them into it. He could easily burn them afterwards. Then he pulled out his watch. It was twenty minutes to two.
vi: Khi cậu về đến thư viện, cậu thấy cái túi và chiếc áo khoác trong góc. Chúng phải được giấu đi đâu đó. Cậu mở cái tủ âm tường bí mật trong ván ốp chân tường, một cái tủ âm tường mà trong đó cậu giữ những bộ đồ cải trang kỳ lạ của mình, và để nó vào trong. Cậu có thể dễ dàng đốt chúng đi sau này. Sau đó cậu kéo đồng hồ ra. Lúc ấy là hai giờ kém hai mươi.
tr: Kitaplığa varınca köşede duran çantayla paltoyu gördü. Bunların bir yere gizlenmesi gerekiyordu. Dorian duvar kaplamasının ardındaki gizli bir gözü açtı. Kılık değiştirmek istediğinde kullandığı değişik, ilginç giysileri sakladığı bu göze çantayla paltoyu yerleştirdi. Bunları sonradan yakmak işten bile değildi. Dorian cep saatine bakarak ikiye yirmi kala olduğunu gördü.
es: Al llegar a la biblioteca, vio en un rincón el abrigo, la gorra y el maletín. Había que esconderlos en algún sitio. Abrió un ropero secreto, oculto en el revestimiento de madera, donde ocultaba sus curiosos disfraces, y los dejó allí. Podría quemarlos sin problemas más adelante. Luego sacó el reloj. Eran las dos menos veinte.
vi_translation: When he returned to the library, he saw the bag and the coat in the corner. They had to be hidden somewhere. He opened the secret closet in the baseboard paneling, a closet where he kept his strange disguises, and put it inside. He could easily burn them later. Then he pulled out the watch. It was twenty to two.
tr_translation: When he reached the bookshelf, he saw the bag and coat standing in the corner. These needed to be hidden somewhere. Dorian opened a secret compartment behind the wall paneling. He placed the bag and coat in this compartment where he stored various, interesting clothes he used when he wanted to disguise himself. It was no big deal to burn them later. Dorian looked at his pocket watch and saw that it was twenty to two.
es_translation: Upon arriving at the library, he saw the coat, cap, and briefcase in a corner. They needed to be hidden somewhere. He opened a secret wardrobe, concealed in the wood paneling, where he hid his curious costumes, and left them there. He could burn them without any problems later. Then he took out the watch. It was twenty to two.

en: He felt that if he brooded on what he had gone through he would sicken or grow mad. There were sins whose fascination was more in the memory than in the doing of them, strange triumphs that gratified the pride more than the passions, and gave to the intellect a quickened sense of joy, greater than any joy they brought, or could ever bring, to the senses. But this was not one of them. It was a thing to be driven out of the mind, to be drugged with poppies, to be strangled lest it might strangle one itself.
vi: Cậu thấy rằng nếu cậu cứ nghiền ngẫm về những gì cậu đã trải qua thì cậu sẽ đổ bệnh hoặc phát điên. Có những tội lỗi mà sự mê hoặc của chúng nằm ở sự nhớ nhiều hơn ở sự làm; những chiến thắng kỳ lạ làm thỏa mãn lòng kiêu hãnh hơn là niềm đam mê, và đem cho trí tuệ một cảm xúc vui sướng sôi nổi, mạnh mẽ hơn bất cứ niềm vui nào mà nó mang lại, hoặc có thể mang lại một lúc nào đó, cho các giác quan. Nhưng đây không phải là một trong số chúng. Nó là thứ bị đuổi ra khỏi tâm hồn, bị chích thuốc phiện, bị bóp cổ để nó không thể tự bóp cổ chính mình.
tr: Dorian’a öyle geliyordu ki dün gece çektiklerini zihnine sardırırsa ya hasta olacak ya da delirecekti. Çekiciliği işlenmesinde değil sonradan anımsanmasında olan günahlar vardı: Duyguların ateşini köreltmekten çok gururu okşayan acayip zaferler ki insanın zihnine bir kıvanç ivmesi verirlerdi ve bu da, duygulara verdikleri kıvançla boy ölçüşemeyecek kadar büyük, canlı olurdu. Gelgelelim bu olay böyle günahlardan biri değildi. Zihinden kovulması, haşhaşla uyuşturulması gereken bir şeydi. Boğulmalıydı, yoksa o adamı boğabilirdi.
es: Sintió que si meditaba sobre lo que le había sucedido se exponía a enfermar o a volverse loco. Había pecados cuya fascinación residía más en la memoria que en su misma realización; extraños triunfos más gratificantes para el orgullo que para las pasiones, y que daban a la inteligencia un sentimiento de alegría más vivo, superior al gozo que procuran o podrían jamás procurar a los sentidos. Pero este último no pertenecía a esa categoría. Se trataba de algo que era necesario expulsar de la mente, adormecerlo con opio, estrangularlo antes de que pudiera estrangularlo a uno.
vi_translation: You find that if you keep brooding over what you have gone through, you will fall ill or go mad. There are sins whose allure lies more in the memory than in the act; strange victories that satisfy pride more than passion, and give the intellect a lively, intense joy greater than any pleasure it brings, or could ever bring, to the senses. But this was not one of them. It is something to be driven out of the soul, drugged with opium, strangled so that it cannot strangle itself.
tr_translation: It seemed to Dorian that if he let the torments of last night replay in his mind, he would either fall ill or go mad. There were sins whose allure lay not in their commission but in their recollection: strange victories that flattered one's pride more than they dulled the fire of emotions, giving a surge of pride to the mind that was far greater and more vivid than the pleasure they gave to the senses. However, this event was not one of those sins. It was something that needed to be banished from the mind, numbed with opium. It had to be drowned, or else it could drown the man.
es_translation: He felt that if he meditated on what had happened to him, he risked falling ill or going mad. There were sins whose fascination lay more in memory than in their actual commission; strange triumphs more gratifying to pride than to passions, and which gave the intellect a livelier feeling of joy, superior to the pleasure that they procure or could ever procure for the senses. But this last one did not belong to that category. It was something that needed to be expelled from the mind, lulled with opium, strangled before it could strangle you.

en: How exquisite they were! As one read them, one seemed to be floating down the green water-ways of the pink and pearl city, seated in a black gondola with silver prow and trailing curtains. The mere lines looked to him like those straight lines of turquoise-blue that follow one as one pushes out to the Lido. The sudden flashes of colour reminded him of the gleam of the opal-and-iris-throated birds that flutter round the tall honeycombed Campanile, or stalk, with such stately grace, through the dim, dust-stained arcades. Leaning back with half-closed eyes, he kept saying over and over to himself:
vi: Sao mà chúng tuyệt vời làm vậy! Lúc ta đọc chúng, ta dường như trôi theo các con kênh xanh lục của một thành phố hồng trân châu, ngồi trong chiếc xuồng đen với mũi bạc và mành quét lê. Chỉ các dòng thơ thôi mà với cậu trông đã giống như những vạch thẳng ngọc lam bám theo ta khi ta phóng về Lido. Ngả ra sau, nhắm hờ đôi mắt, cậu cứ nói mãi nói mãi với mình:
tr: Nasıl da nefisti bu dizeler! İnsan bu satırları okurken o pembeli sedefli kentin yeşil sudan yollarında, perdeleri uçuşmuş, burnu gümüşten bir siyah gondol içinde kayıp geçer gibi oluyordu. Salt bu satırların biçimi bile Dorian’a, Lido’ya giderken izlenen o firuze mavisi, düz çizgileri çağrıştırıyordu. Birden çakan renkler ona yüksek, petekli Campanile çevresinde kanat çırpan, tozlu loş kemerlerin altında ağırbaşlı bir uyumla yürüyen o yanardöner mor boyunlu kuşları anımsatıyordu. es: ¡Qué versos exquisitos! Al leerlos se tenía la impresión de estar flotando por los verdes canales de la ciudad de color rosa y gris perla, sentado en una góndola negra con la proa de plata y unos cendales arrastrados por la brisa. Los versos mismos le parecían las rectas estelas azul turquesa que siguen al visitante cuando navega hacia el Lido. Los repentinos estallidos de color le recordaban los destellos de las palomas —la garganta de color ópalo e iris— que revolotean en torno al esbelto campanile acolmenado, o que pasean, con tranquila elegancia, entre los polvorientos arcos en penumbra. Recostándose, con los ojos semicerrados, Dorian repitió una y otra vez los versos:
vi_translation: How wonderful they are! When I read them, I seem to drift along the green canals of a pink pearl city, sitting in a black boat with a silver prow and a trailing canopy. Just the lines of poetry alone, to you, seem like turquoise streaks following me as I speed towards Lido. The sudden flashes of color remind you of the flickering light of the cat-eyed, emerald-throated, and multi-colored birds fluttering around the towering, honeycomb-like Bell Tower, or gracefully soaring, with an air of majestic elegance, through the dark, dusty arches. Leaning back, eyes half-closed, you keep talking to yourself endlessly:

en: He heaved a deep breath, opened the door a little wider, and with half-closed eyes and averted head, walked quickly in, determined that he would not look even once upon the dead man. Then, stooping down and taking up the gold-and-purple hanging, he flung it right over the picture.
vi: Cậu thốt ra một hơi thở sâu, mở cửa rộng hơn một chút, và với đôi mắt nhắm hờ cùng cái đầu ngoảnh đi, bước nhanh vào, kiên quyết là cậu sẽ không nhìn thậm chí một lần vào người chết. Sau đó, cúi xuống, lấy tấm trướng vàng và tía ấy lên, cậu quăng nó thẳng lên trên bức tranh.
tr: Dorian derin bir göğüs geçirdi, kapıyı biraz daha açtı, sonra başını çevirip gözlerini yarı yumarak içeri daldı. Ölüye bir kez bile bakmamaya kararlıydı. Yere eğildi, sırmalı mor örtüyü kaldırdı, resmin üzerine fırlattı.
es: Respiró hondo, abrió un poco más la puerta y, con los ojos medio cerrados y la cabeza vuelta, entró rápidamente, decidido a no mirar ni siquiera una vez al muerto. Luego, agachándose, recogió la tela morada y oro y la arrojó directamente sobre el cuadro.
vi_translation: He let out a deep breath, opened the door a bit wider, and with half-closed eyes and a turned-away head, quickly stepped in, determined not to look even once at the dead person. Then, bending down, he picked up the golden and purple curtain and threw it straight over the painting.
tr_translation: Dorian took a deep breath, opened the door a bit more, then turned his head and darted inside, half-closing his eyes. He was determined not to look at the dead body even once. He bent down, lifted the embroidered purple cloth, and threw it over the painting.
es_translation: He took a deep breath, opened the door a bit wider, and, with his eyes half-closed and his head turned away, quickly entered, determined not to look at the dead man even once. Then, bending down, he picked up the purple and gold cloth and threw it directly over the painting.

en: “She is still décolletée,” he answered, taking an olive in his long fingers; “and when she is in a very smart gown she looks like an édition de luxe of a bad French novel. She is really wonderful, and full of surprises. Her capacity for family affection is extraordinary. When her third husband died, her hair turned quite gold from grief.”
vi: “Cô ấy vẫn còn décolletée,” y trả lời, nhặt một trái ô-liu bằng các ngón tay dài của mình; “và khi cô ấy mặc một chiếc áo dài rất sang thì trông cô ấy như một édition de luxe2 của một tiểu thuyết Pháp dở tệ. Cô ấy thật sự tuyệt vời, và đầy bất ngờ. “Khả năng yêu thương gia đình của cô ấy rất phi thường. Khi chồng thứ ba của cô ấy chết, tóc cô ấy đổi màu vàng óng vì thương tiếc. 2 Bản in cao cấp.
tr: Lord Henry o uzun parmaklarıyla bir zeytin alarak, “Kendisi şimdi de décolletée geziyor,” diye yanıtladı. “Çok şık giyindiği zamanlarda da kötü bir Fransız romanının de luxe basımını andırıyor. Gerçekten harika bir kadın, şaşırtmacalarla dolu. Hele aile sevgisi görülmedik bir şey. Üçüncü kocası öldüğünde zavallının saçları kederden sapsarı kesilmişti.
es: —Sigue siendo partidaria de los escotes —respondió lord Henry, cogiendo una aceituna con los dedos—, y cuando lleva un vestido muy elegante parece una édítion de luxe de una mala novela francesa. Es realmente maravillosa y siempre depara sorpresas. Su capacidad para el afecto familiar es extraordinaria. Al morir su tercer esposo, el cabello se le puso completamente dorado de la pena.

en: “Of course, with their ages, slightly edited. But nothing must be done in a hurry. I want it to be what The Morning Post calls a suitable alliance, and I want you both to be happy.”
vi: “Dĩ nhiên, với tuổi của họ, có sửa sơ sơ. Nhưng chẳng việc gì phải vội. Tôi muốn nó như là cái mà báo The Morning Post vẫn gọi là môn đăng hộ đối, và tôi muốn vợ chồng cậu được hạnh phúc.
tr: “Elbet yaşları da belirtilecek, ufak tefek rötuşlarla. Yalnız bu iş aceleye gelmemeli. Bunun, The Morning Post gazetesinde dedikleri gibi, uygun bir bileşim olmasını istiyorum, ikinizin de çok mutlu olmanızı istiyorum.
es: —Sin olvidar la edad, por supuesto, aunque ligeramente revisada. Pero no debe hacerse nada con prisas. Quiero que sea lo que The Morning Post llama un enlace conveniente, y que los dos sean felices.
vi_translation: “Of course, at their age, there are some minor adjustments. But there's no need to rush. I want it to be what The Morning Post calls a well-matched marriage, and I want you two to be happy.”
tr_translation: “Of course, their ages will also be mentioned, with minor retouches. But this job should not be rushed. I want this to be, as they say in The Morning Post newspaper, an appropriate composition, I want both of you to be very happy.”

en: “An eternity, she tells me. I believe, according to the peerage, it is ten years, but ten years with Monmouth must have been like eternity, with time thrown in. Who else is coming?”
vi: “Một thời gian vô tận, cô ấy bảo tôi thế. Tôi nghĩ, theo cuốn phả hệ quý tộc, là mười năm, nhưng mười năm với Monmouth hẳn là như vô tận, với thời gian bị ném vào đó. Còn ai khác đến không?”
tr: “Ezelden beri, kendi söylediğine bakılırsa. Soylular almanağına göreyse on yıl, sanıyorum. Gelgelelim Monmouth’la geçirilen on yıl sonsuzluktan bile daha uzun gelmiştir, herhalde. Başka kimler geliyor?
es: —Una eternidad, me dice. Según el libro nobiliario, creo que diez años, pero diez años con Monmouth pueden ser una eternidad e incluso un poco más. ¿Quiénes son los otros invitados?
vi_translation: “An endless amount of time, she told me so. I think, according to the noble genealogy book, it is ten years, but ten years with Monmouth must feel like an eternity, with time thrown into it. Did anyone else come?”
tr_translation: “Since time immemorial, according to what he says. According to the almanac of the nobles, it's ten years, I believe. However, ten years spent with Monmouth must have felt longer than eternity. Who else is coming?”
es_translation: —An eternity, she tells me. According to the peerage book, I believe ten years, but ten years with Monmouth can be an eternity and even a bit more. Who are the other guests?

en: Suddenly he started. His eyes grew strangely bright, and he gnawed nervously at his underlip. Between two of the windows stood a large Florentine cabinet, made out of ebony and inlaid with ivory and blue lapis. He watched it as though it were a thing that could fascinate and make afraid, as though it held something that he longed for and yet almost loathed. His breath quickened. A mad craving came over him. He lit a cigarette and then threw it away. His eyelids drooped till the long fringed lashes almost touched his cheek. But he still watched the cabinet. At last he got up from the sofa on which he had been lying, went over to it, and having unlocked it, touched some hidden spring. A triangular drawer passed slowly out. His fingers moved instinctively towards it, dipped in, and closed on something. It was a small Chinese box of black and gold-dust lacquer, elaborately wrought, the sides patterned with curved waves, and the silken cords hung with round crystals and tasselled in plaited metal threads. He opened it. Inside was a green paste, waxy in lustre, the odour curiously heavy and persistent.
vi: Đột nhiên cậu giật mình. Mắt cậu sáng rực lên một cách kỳ lạ, và cậu bồn chồn gặm môi dưới. Giữa hai cửa sổ có để một cái tủ Florence lớn, làm từ gỗ mun, khảm ngà voi và ngọc lưu li. Cậu nhìn nó như thể nó là một thứ có thể thôi miên hoặc gây ra nỗi sợ, như thể nó giữ cái gì đó mà cậu ước ao tuy nhiên lại gần như ghê tởm. Hơi thở cậu gấp gáp hơn. Một khát khao điên dại ập đến với cậu. Cậu châm một điếu thuốc rồi ném nó đi. Mi mắt cậu rủ xuống cho đến khi hàng lông mi tua rua dài ấy gần như chạm vào má. Nhưng cậu vẫn nhìn cái tủ. Cuối cùng cậu đứng dậy khỏi chiếc xô-pha mà cậu đang nằm trên đó, lại gần nó, và, sau khi mở nó ra, chạm vào cái lò xo ngầm nào đó. Một ngăn kéo tam giác chầm chậm chạy ra. Các ngón tay cậu mò mẫm theo bản năng về phía nó, thò vào trong, đến sát thứ gì đó. Nó là một cái hộp sơn mài đen và bụi vàng của Trung Quốc, chế tác công phu, các mặt được trang trí các làn sóng uốn lượn, với các sợi dây lụa treo pha lê tròn và có núm tua bằng chỉ kim loại bện. Cậu mở nó ra. Bên trong có một cục bột xanh lục, bóng như sáp, mùi bền và nặng lạ lùng.
tr: Sonunda uzanmış olduğu kanepeden kalkarak dolabın başına gitti, kapısını açarak içindeki gizli bir yaya bastı. Yavaş yavaş üçgen bir çekmece ortaya çıktı. Dorian’ın parmakları sanki kendiliklerinden çekmeceye yanaştı, içeri daldı, bir şey bulup kavradı. Altın tozu serpmeli siyah lake bir Çin kutusuydu bu. Yanları yuvarlak, dalga biçimi olukluydu, ipek kordonlarına yuvarlak cam boncuklar geçmiş, püskülleri metal ipliklerden örülmüştü. Dorian kutuyu açtı. İçinde balmumu solgunluğunda yeşil bir macun duruyordu, kokusu tuhaf, ağır ve kalıcıydı.
es: De repente tuvo un sobresalto. Sus ojos se iluminaron extrañamente y empezó a mordisquearse el labio inferior. Entre dos de las ventanas de la biblioteca había un voluminoso bargueño florentino de caoba, con incrustaciones de marfil y lapislázuli. Lo contempló como si fuera algo terrible y fascinante al mismo tiempo, como si contuviera algo que anhelaba y que, sin embargo, casi aborrecía. Su respiración se aceleró. Un deseo furioso se apoderó de él. Encendió un cigarrillo que tiró instantes después. Dejó caer los párpados hasta que las largas pestañas casi le tocaban la mejilla. Pero seguía mirando al bargueño. Finalmente se levantó del sofá donde había estado tumbado, se acercó a él y, después de descorrer el pestillo, tocó un resorte escondido. Lentamente apareció un cajón triangular. Sus dedos se movieron instintivamente hacia su interior y se apoderaron de algo. Era una cajita china de laca negra recubierta de polvo de oro, delicadamente trabajada; sus paredes estaban decoradas con sinuosas ondulaciones, y de los cordoncillos de seda colgaban cristales redondos y borlas tejidas con hilos metálicos. Dorian Gray la abrió. Dentro había una pasta verde que tenía el brillo de la cera y que desprendía un olor peculiar, denso y persistente.
vi_translation: Suddenly, he was startled. His eyes lit up in a strange way, and he nervously bit his lower lip. Between the two windows stood a large Florence cabinet, made of ebony, inlaid with ivory and lapis lazuli. He looked at it as if it could hypnotize or cause fear, as if it held something he desired yet almost detested. His breath quickened. A mad desire overwhelmed him. He lit a cigarette and then threw it away. His eyelids drooped until those long fringed lashes almost touched his cheeks. But he still looked at the cabinet. Finally, he got up from the sofa he was lying on, approached it, and, after opening it, touched some hidden spring. A triangular drawer slowly slid out. His fingers instinctively fumbled towards it, reaching inside, close to something. It was a Chinese lacquer box with black and gold dust, intricately crafted, the sides decorated with undulating waves, with silk cords hanging round crystals and tassels braided with metallic threads. He opened it. Inside was a greenish-blue lump, shiny like wax, with a strangely persistent and heavy scent.
tr_translation: Finally, he got up from the couch he had been lying on and went to the cabinet, opened its door, and pressed a hidden spring inside. Slowly, a triangular drawer emerged. Dorian's fingers seemed to move towards the drawer on their own, plunged inside, found something, and grasped it. It was a black lacquered Chinese box sprinkled with gold dust. Its sides were rounded and wave-shaped, with round glass beads threaded onto its silk cords, and its tassels were woven from metallic threads. Dorian opened the box. Inside was a green paste with the pallor of wax, its scent strange, heavy, and lingering.
es_translation: Suddenly, he had a start. His eyes lit up strangely and he began to nibble on his lower lip. Between two of the library windows, there was a large Florentine mahogany cabinet, inlaid with ivory and lapis lazuli. He gazed at it as if it were something terrible and fascinating at the same time, as if it contained something he longed for and yet almost loathed. His breathing quickened. A furious desire took hold of him. He lit a cigarette which he discarded moments later. He let his eyelids drop until his long lashes almost touched his cheek. But he kept looking at the cabinet. Finally, he got up from the sofa where he had been lying, approached it, and, after sliding back the latch, touched a hidden spring. A triangular drawer slowly appeared. His fingers instinctively moved inside and seized something. It was a Chinese box of black lacquer covered in gold dust, delicately crafted; its walls were decorated with sinuous undulations, and round crystals and tassels woven with metallic threads hung from the silk cords. Dorian Gray opened it. Inside, there was a green paste that had the sheen of wax and emitted a peculiar, dense, and persistent odor.

en: He hesitated for some moments, with a strangely immobile smile upon his face. Then shivering, though the atmosphere of the room was terribly hot, he drew himself up and glanced at the clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. He put the box back, shutting the cabinet doors as he did so, and went into his bedroom.
vi: Cậu lưỡng lự một lúc, với nụ cười bất động kỳ lạ trên mặt. Sau đó cậu rùng mình, mặc dù không khí trong phòng nóng không chịu nổi, cậu thẳng người dậy, liếc nhìn đồng hồ. Lúc ấy là mười hai giờ kém hai mươi. Cậu đẩy cái hộp lại, đóng cửa tủ lúc làm vậy, và vào trong phòng ngủ.
tr: Dorian, yüzünde garip, donuk bir gülüşle biraz duraksadı. Sonra, odanın son derece sıcak olmasına karşın ürpererek şöyle bir doğrulup duvar saatine göz attı. On ikiye yirmi dakika vardı. Dorian kutuyu yerli yerine koyup dolap kapısını kapatarak yatak odasına geçti.
es: Vaciló unos momentos, con una extraña sonrisa inmóvil en el rostro. Luego, tiritando, aunque en la biblioteca hacía muchísimo calor, se irguió y miró el reloj. Faltaban veinte minutos para las doce. Devolvió la cajita china al bargueño, cerró la puerta y pasó a su dormitorio.
vi_translation: He hesitated for a moment, with a strange, motionless smile on his face. Then he shivered, even though the air in the room was unbearably hot, he straightened up, glanced at the clock. It was twenty to twelve. He pushed the box back, closed the cabinet door as he did so, and went into the bedroom.
tr_translation: Dorian paused for a moment with a strange, dull smile on his face. Then, despite the room being extremely warm, he shivered, straightened up, and glanced at the wall clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. Dorian put the box back in its place, closed the closet door, and went to the bedroom.
es_translation: He hesitated for a few moments, with a strange, immobile smile on his face. Then, shivering, although it was very warm in the library, he stood up and looked at the clock. It was twenty minutes to twelve. He returned the Chinese box to the writing desk, closed the door, and went to his bedroom.

en: On and on plodded the hansom, going slower, it seemed to him, at each step. He thrust up the trap and called to the man to drive faster. The hideous hunger for opium began to gnaw at him. His throat burned and his delicate hands twitched nervously together. He struck at the horse madly with his stick. The driver laughed and whipped up. He laughed in answer, and the man was silent.
vi: Cậu cảm thấy dường như cỗ xe hai bánh ấy nặng nề lết tới, lết tới, chậm dần, theo từng bước. Cậu đẩy ô cửa sập lên, kêu xà ích cho xe chạy nhanh hơn. Cơn đói thuốc gớm guốc bắt đầu giày vò cậu. Họng cậu cháy bỏng, đôi tay mềm mại thì co quắp bồn chồn liên tục. Cậu đập gậy như điên lên con ngựa. Xà ích bật cười, giục ngựa chạy tới. Cậu cười đáp lại, và người ấy lặng thinh.
tr: Araba hâlâ yol alıyor, ama Dorian’a her adımda daha yavaşlıyormuş gibi geliyordu. Dorian öndeki kapağı kaldırarak daha hızlı sürsün diye arabacıya bağırdı. Afyona duyduğu iğrenç istek içini kemirmeye başlamıştı. Boğazı yanıyor, o ince elleri sinirden kilitlenip açılıyordu. Bastonuyla delicesine ata vurdu. Arabacı gülerek kamçısını şaklattı. Dorian da karşılık olarak gülünce adam sesini kesti.
es: El coche de punto avanzaba laboriosamente, disminuyendo la velocidad, le parecía a Dorian Gray, con cada paso. Abrió con violencia la trampilla del techo y ordenó al cochero que acelerase la marcha. La terrible ansia del opio empezaba a devorarlo. Le ardía la garganta y sus delicadas manos se habían contagiado de un temblor nervioso. Sacando un brazo por la ventanilla golpeó ferozmente al caballo con su bastón. El cochero se echó a reír y también él utilizó su látigo. Dorian Gray respondió riendo a su vez y el otro guardó silencio.
vi_translation: He felt as if the two-wheeled carriage was laboriously dragging itself along, dragging itself along, slowing down with each step. He pushed up the trapdoor and called out to the coachman to make the carriage go faster. The horrible craving for drugs began to torment him. His throat burned, and his soft hands twitched restlessly. He beat the horse madly with his stick. The coachman laughed and urged the horse forward. He laughed in response, and the coachman fell silent.
tr_translation: The carriage was still moving, but it seemed to Dorian that it was slowing down with every step. Dorian lifted the front flap and shouted at the driver to go faster. The disgusting craving for opium had started to gnaw at him. His throat was burning, and his slender hands were clenching and unclenching with nerves. He struck the horse wildly with his cane. The driver laughed and cracked his whip. When Dorian laughed in response, the man fell silent.
es_translation: The cab moved laboriously, slowing down, it seemed to Dorian Gray, with each step. He violently opened the roof hatch and ordered the driver to speed up. The terrible craving for opium began to consume him. His throat burned and his delicate hands had caught a nervous tremor. Sticking an arm out the window, he fiercely struck the horse with his cane. The driver laughed and he too used his whip. Dorian Gray responded by laughing in turn and the other fell silent.

en: After some time they left the clay road and rattled again over rough-paven streets. Most of the windows were dark, but now and then fantastic shadows were silhouetted against some lamplit blind. He watched them curiously. They moved like monstrous marionettes and made gestures like live things. He hated them. A dull rage was in his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman yelled something at them from an open door, and two men ran after the hansom for about a hundred yards. The driver beat at them with his whip.
vi: Một lát sau, họ rời khỏi đường đất, và lại chạy lóc cóc trên các con phố lát gồ ghề. Phần lớn cửa sổ tối om, nhưng thỉnh thoảng có những cái bóng kỳ dị in hình lên tấm rèm sáng đèn nào đó. Cậu tò mò quan sát chúng. Chúng chuyển động như các con rối khổng lồ, làm điệu bộ y như những vật sống. Cậu ghét chúng. Một cơn giận âm ỉ trong tim cậu. Lúc họ rẽ qua một góc phố, một người đàn bà la hét gì đó với họ từ một ô cửa mở, và hai người đàn ông chạy theo cỗ xe độ trăm thước mới thôi. Xà ích quất họ bằng roi da.
tr: Bir süre sonra balçık yoldan ayrılıp yamru yumru parke döşeli sokaklardan tangır tungur geçtiler. Buralardaki pencerelerin çoğu karanlıktı, gene de arada bir, lambayla aydınlanmış bir perdeye acayip gölgeler vuruyor ve Dorian bunlara merakla bakıyordu. Gölgeler dev kuklalar gibi oynaşıyor, canlı birer yaratıkmışçasına el kol sallıyorlardı. Dorian nefret ediyordu onlardan. Yüreğini donuk bir hınç bürüyordu. Bir köşeyi dönerlerken açık bir kapı aralığından bir kadın onlara bağırarak bir şeyler söyledi; iki adam yüz adım kadar arabanın ardından koştular. Arabacı onlara kırbacıyla vurdu.
es: Después de algún tiempo dejaron el camino de tierra y volvieron a traquetear por calles mal pavimentadas. La mayoría de las ventanas estaba a oscuras pero, a veces, sombras fantásticas se dibujaban sobre los estores iluminados por alguna lámpara. Dorian Gray las contemplaba con curiosidad. Se movían como marionetas monstruosas y hacían gestos de criaturas vivas. Sintió que las aborrecía. Tenía el corazón dominado por una rabia sorda. Al torcer una esquina, una mujer les gritó algo desde una puerta abierta, y dos hombres corrieron tras el coche de punto por espacio de unos cien metros. El cochero los golpeó con el látigo.
vi_translation: A moment later, they left the dirt road and started clattering along the rough cobbled streets again. Most of the windows were dark, but occasionally strange shadows were cast on the lit curtains. He curiously observed them. They moved like giant puppets, gesturing as if they were alive. He hated them. A smoldering anger burned in his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from an open window, and two men chased the carriage for about a hundred yards before giving up. The coachman whipped them with a leather strap.
tr_translation: After a while, they left the muddy road and clattered through the bumpy cobblestone streets. Most of the windows around here were dark, yet occasionally, strange shadows were cast on a curtain lit by a lamp, and Dorian watched them with curiosity. The shadows moved like giant puppets, waving their arms as if they were living creatures. Dorian hated them. A dull resentment filled his heart. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from the gap of an open door; two men ran after the carriage for about a hundred steps. The coachman struck them with his whip.
es_translation: After some time, they left the dirt road and began to rattle along poorly paved streets again. Most of the windows were dark, but occasionally, fantastic shadows were cast on the blinds illuminated by some lamp. Dorian Gray watched them with curiosity. They moved like monstrous puppets and made gestures like living creatures. He felt that he loathed them. His heart was dominated by a dull rage. As they turned a corner, a woman shouted something at them from an open door, and two men ran after the cab for about a hundred meters. The coachman struck them with his whip.

en: Suddenly the man drew up with a jerk at the top of a dark lane. Over the low roofs and jagged chimney-stacks of the houses rose the black masts of ships. Wreaths of white mist clung like ghostly sails to the yards.
vi: Đột nhiên người đó dừng xe lại với một cú giật mạnh thình lình trên đầu một ngõ tối. Trên các nóc thấp lè tè và các cụm ống khói lởm chởm của những ngôi nhà, mọc lên các cột buồm đen của những con tàu. Các đám sương trắng cuồn cuộn bám như những cánh buồm ma vào các trục căng buồm.
tr: Karanlık bir toprak yolun başında arabacı birden dizginleri çekerek durdu. Buradaki evlerin alçak damlarının, çentikli baca kümelerinin ardından kara gemi direkleri yükseliyordu. Beyaz sis halkaları avluların, serenlerin üzerinde hayalet yelkenler gibiydi.
es: De repente, el cochero se detuvo con un movimiento brusco al comienzo de una callejuela en sombras. Sobre los bajos tejados, erizados de chimeneas, se alzaban las negras arboladuras de los barcos. Espirales de niebla blanca se aferraban a las vergas como velas fantasmales.
vi_translation: Suddenly, the person stopped the vehicle with a sudden, strong jerk at the head of a dark alley. On the low, squat roofs and the jagged clusters of chimneys of the houses, the black masts of ships rose up. Billowing white fog clung to the taut masts like ghostly sails.
tr_translation: At the beginning of a dark dirt road, the coachman suddenly pulled the reins and stopped. Behind the low roofs of the houses here, and the jagged clusters of chimneys, black ship masts were rising. White rings of mist over the courtyards and spars were like ghostly sails.
es_translation: Suddenly, the coachman stopped abruptly at the beginning of a shadowy alley. Above the low rooftops, bristling with chimneys, the black masts of the ships rose. Spirals of white mist clung to the yards like ghostly sails.

en: The drowsy sailor leaped to his feet as she spoke, and looked wildly round. The sound of the shutting of the hall door fell on his ear. He rushed out as if in pursuit.
vi: Gã thủy thủ ngủ gật nhảy dựng lên khi nghe mụ nói, điên cuồng nhìn quanh. Tiếng đóng cửa sảnh vang đến tai y. Y lao ra ngoài như thể để truy lùng.
tr: Onun bu sözleri üzerine masa başında uyuklayan gemici ayağa fırladı ve çılgın gözlerle çevresini taradı. Kulağına kapanan kapının sesi geldi. Adam kovaladığı biri varmış gibi dışarı koştu.
es: El marinero adormilado se levantó de un salto al oír a la mujer, y miró con ojos enloquecidos a su alrededor. El sonido de la puerta al cerrarse llegó hasta sus oídos, y salió precipitadamente, como en persecución de alguien.
vi_translation: The dozing sailor jumped up when he heard the woman speak, frantically looking around. The sound of the hall door closing reached his ears. He rushed outside as if to pursue.
tr_translation: Upon hearing these words, the sailor who was dozing at the table jumped up and scanned his surroundings with wild eyes. He heard the sound of a door closing. The man ran outside as if he were chasing someone.
es_translation: The drowsy sailor jumped up upon hearing the woman, and looked around with crazed eyes. The sound of the door closing reached his ears, and he rushed out, as if in pursuit of someone.

en: “How can you say that? I admit that I think that it is better to be beautiful than to be good. But on the other hand, no one is more ready than I am to acknowledge that it is better to be good than to be ugly.”
vi: “Sao cô có thể nói thế được? Tôi thừa nhận rằng tôi nghĩ là đẹp thì hơn ngoan. Nhưng mặt khác thì không ai sẵn sàng công nhận hơn tôi là ngoan thì hơn xấu.”
tr: “Nasıl böyle söylersin? Gerçi itiraf ederim, güzel olmanın erdemli olmaktan iyi olduğu görüşündeyimdir. Öte yandan erdemli olmanın çirkin olmaktan yeğ olduğunu da herkesten önce ben kabul ederim.
es: —¿Cómo puedes decir eso? Reconozco que, en mi opinión, es mejor ser hermoso que bueno. Pero, por otra parte, nadie está más dispuesto que yo a admitir que es mejor ser bueno que feo.
vi_translation: “How can you say that? I admit that I think being beautiful is better than being obedient. But on the other hand, no one is more willing to acknowledge than I am that being obedient is better than being ugly.”
tr_translation: "How can you say such a thing? Although I admit, I am of the opinion that being beautiful is better than being virtuous. On the other hand, I am the first to accept that being virtuous is preferable to being ugly."
es_translation: —How can you say that? I recognize that, in my opinion, it is better to be beautiful than good. But, on the other hand, no one is more willing than I am to admit that it is better to be good than ugly.

en: “Not with women,” said the duchess, shaking her head; “and women rule the world. I assure you we can’t bear mediocrities. We women, as some one says, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, if you ever love at all.”
vi: “Không phải với đàn bà,” nữ công tước vừa nói vừa lắc đầu; “và đàn bà thống trị thế gian. Tôi đoan chắc với anh rằng chúng tôi không thể chịu được bọn người tầm thường. Đàn bà chúng tôi, như ai đó nói, yêu bằng tai, y như đàn ông các anh yêu bằng mắt, ấy là giả dụ như các anh nói chung có khi nào đó biết yêu.”
tr: Düşes, “Kadınlar için hiç de öyle değil,” diye başını salladı. “Dünyayı yönetenler de kadınlardır. İnanın bana, orta karar şeylerden nefret ederiz biz. Birilerinin dediği gibi, biz kadınlar kulağımızla severiz, nasıl ki siz erkekler de gözünüzle seversiniz, yani severseniz eğer.
es: —No en el caso de las mujeres —dijo la duquesa agitando la cabeza—; y las mujeres gobiernan el mundo. Te aseguro que no soportan a los mediocres. Nosotras las mujeres, como dice alguien, amamos con los oídos, igual que vosotros, los hombres, amáis con los ojos, si es que amáis alguna vez.
vi_translation: “Not with women,” the duchess said, shaking her head; “and women rule the world. I assure you that we cannot stand ordinary people. We women, as someone said, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, that is, assuming you ever know how to love at all.”
tr_translation: The Duchess shook her head, "Not at all for women," she said. "It is women who rule the world. Believe me, we hate mediocre things. As someone once said, we women love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, that is, if you love at all."
es_translation: —Not in the case of women —said the duchess, shaking her head—; and women rule the world. I assure you they do not tolerate mediocrity. We women, as someone says, love with our ears, just as you men love with your eyes, if you ever love at all.

en: After breakfast, he walked with the duchess for an hour in the garden and then drove across the park to join the shooting-party. The crisp frost lay like salt upon the grass. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin film of ice bordered the flat, reed-grown lake.
vi: Sau bữa sáng, cậu dạo bước cùng nữ công tước độ một giờ trong vườn, sau đó chạy xe ngang qua công viên để tham gia vào nhóm săn. Sương giá giòn tan nằm như muối trên cỏ. Bầu trời là cái cốc lộn ngược bằng kim loại xanh lam. Một màng băng mỏng viền quanh con hồ bằng phẳng mọc đầy sậy.
tr: Kahvaltıdan sonra düşesle bahçede bir saat dolaştı, sonra arabaya binerek parkın öbür ucundaki av partisine katılmaya gitti. Çıtırtılı kırağı otların üzerine tuz gibi yayılmıştı. Gökyüzü mavi metalden, ters dönmüş bir kupaydı. Kamışlı durgun gölün kıyılarını ince bir tuz tabakası çevirmişti.
es: Después del desayuno paseó con la duquesa por el jardín durante una hora, y luego atravesó el parque en coche para reunirse con la partida de caza. La escarcha matinal recubría la hierba como un manto de sal. El cielo era una copa invertida de metal azul. Una delgada capa de hielo bordeaba el lago inmóvil donde crecían los juncos.
vi_translation: After breakfast, he strolled with the duchess for about an hour in the garden, then drove through the park to join the hunting party. The crisp frost lay like salt on the grass. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of ice bordered the flat lake filled with reeds.
tr_translation: After breakfast, he walked in the garden with the duchess for an hour, then got into the carriage and went to join the hunting party at the other end of the park. The crackling frost was spread over the grass like salt. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of salt surrounded the shores of the still, reedy lake.
es_translation: After breakfast, he walked with the duchess in the garden for an hour, and then crossed the park by carriage to join the hunting party. The morning frost covered the grass like a mantle of salt. The sky was an inverted cup of blue metal. A thin layer of ice bordered the still lake where the reeds grew.

en: At last he reached the Home Farm. Two men were loitering in the yard. He leaped from the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. In the farthest stable a light was glimmering. Something seemed to tell him that the body was there, and he hurried to the door and put his hand upon the latch.
vi: Cuối cùng cậu cũng đến Trang trại Gia đình. Hai người đàn ông đang tha thẩn trong sân. Cậu nhảy khỏi yên và ném dây cương cho một trong số họ. Ở chuồng ngựa xa nhất, một ánh đèn le lói. Có gì đó dường như mách cậu là cái xác đang ở đó, và cậu hấp tấp chạy đến cửa, đặt tay lên then.
tr: Sonunda çiftlik evine vardılar. Avluda iki adam duruyordu. Dorian yere atladı, dizgini adamlardan birine attı. Önündeki ahırda bir ışık yanmaktaydı. Bir ses ölünün orada olduğunu söylemiş gibi Dorian çabucak kapıya yürüdü, elini mandala uzattı.
es: Finalmente llegó a la granja y encontró a dos hombres ociosos en el patio. Dorian saltó de la silla y le arrojó a uno de ellos las riendas. En el establo más distante parpadeaba una luz. Algo le dijo que allí se hallaba el cadáver. Corrió hacia la puerta y puso la mano en el picaporte.
vi_translation: Finally, you arrived at the Family Farm. Two men were wandering in the yard. You jumped off the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. In the farthest stable, a light flickered. Something seemed to tell you that the body was there, and you hurriedly ran to the door, placing your hand on the latch.
tr_translation: Finally, they arrived at the farmhouse. Two men were standing in the yard. Dorian jumped to the ground and threw the reins to one of the men. A light was shining in the stable in front of him. As if a voice had told him the dead body was there, Dorian quickly walked to the door and reached for the latch.
es_translation: Finally, he arrived at the farm and found two idle men in the yard. Dorian jumped off the saddle and threw the reins to one of them. A light flickered in the farthest stable. Something told him that the corpse was there. He ran to the door and put his hand on the doorknob.

en: “You have not yet told me what your good action was. Or did you say you had done more than one?” asked his companion as he spilled into his plate a little crimson pyramid of seeded strawberries and, through a perforated, shell-shaped spoon, snowed white sugar upon them.
vi: “Cậu chưa nói cho tôi biết việc tốt của cậu là gì. Hay cậu vừa nói là cậu đã làm nhiều hơn là một việc?” bạn cậu hỏi, lúc y đổ vào đĩa mình một hình chóp nhỏ đỏ chót những hạt dâu tây đã lẩy hạt, và, qua một cái thìa hình vỏ sò xoi lỗ, rắc đường trắng lên chúng như tuyết.
tr: Arkadaşı, “Yaptığın iyi şeyi söylemedin ya. Yoksa sayısı birden çok muydu?” diye sorarak tabağındaki küçük, kırmızı çilek piramidini yıktı, deniz kabuğu biçiminde, delikli bir kaşıkla üzerlerine pudraşekeri serpti.
es: —No me has contado cuál ha sido tu buena acción de ayer. ¿O fue más de una? —preguntó su interlocutor, mientras vertía sobre su plato una pequeña pirámide carmesí de fresas maduras, blanqueándolas luego con azúcar mediante una cuchara perforada en forma de concha.
vi_translation: “You haven't told me what your good deed is yet. Or did you just say that you have done more than one thing?” your friend asked, as he poured onto his plate a small red pyramid of hulled strawberries, and, through a perforated shell-shaped spoon, sprinkled white sugar on them like snow.
tr_translation: Your friend said, "You didn't mention the good thing you did. Or was there more than one?" and as he asked, he toppled the small, red strawberry pyramid on his plate and sprinkled powdered sugar over them with a perforated, seashell-shaped spoon.
es_translation: —You haven't told me what your good deed was yesterday. Or was it more than one? —asked his interlocutor, while pouring a small crimson pyramid of ripe strawberries onto his plate, then whitening them with sugar using a perforated spoon shaped like a shell.

en: A new life! That was what he wanted. That was what he was waiting for. Surely he had begun it already. He had spared one innocent thing, at any rate. He would never again tempt innocence. He would be good.
vi: Một cuộc đời mới! Đó là cái mà cậu cần. Đó là cái mà cậu chờ đợi. Chắc chắn là cậu đã bắt đầu nó rồi. Dẫu gì thì cậu cũng đã tha cho một sinh vật ngây thơ. Cậu sẽ không bao giờ cám dỗ người ngây thơ nữa. Cậu sẽ tử tế.
tr: Yeni bir yaşam! Dorian’ın istediği buydu. Beklediği de buydu. Hatta bu yeni yaşama daha şimdiden başlamış sayılırdı. Hiç değilse bir masum varlığı esirgemişti ya! Bir daha masumları baştan çıkarmaya asla kalkışmayacaktı. İyi insan olacaktı.
es: ¡Una vida nueva! Eso era lo que necesitaba. Eso era lo que estaba esperando. Sin duda la había empezado ya. Había evitado, al menos, la perdición de una criatura inocente. Nunca volvería a poner la tentación en el camino de la inocencia. Sería bueno.
vi_translation: A new life! That's what you need. That's what you have been waiting for. Surely, you have already started it. After all, you have spared an innocent creature. You will never tempt the innocent again. You will be kind.
tr_translation: A new life! This is what Dorian wanted. This is what he had been waiting for. In fact, he could already be considered to have started this new life. At least he had spared an innocent being! He would never again attempt to corrupt the innocent. He would be a good person.
es_translation: A new life! That was what I needed. That was what I was waiting for. Without a doubt, I had already started it. I had avoided, at least, the ruin of an innocent creature. I would never again place temptation in the path of innocence. I would be good.

en: But this murder—was it to dog him all his life? Was he always to be burdened by his past? Was he really to confess? Never. There was only one bit of evidence left against him. The picture itself—that was evidence. He would destroy it. Why had he kept it so long? Once it had given him pleasure to watch it changing and growing old. Of late he had felt no such pleasure. It had kept him awake at night. When he had been away, he had been filled with terror lest other eyes should look upon it. It had brought melancholy across his passions. Its mere memory had marred many moments of joy. It had been like conscience to him. Yes, it had been conscience. He would destroy it.
vi: Nhưng tội giết người này — chẳng lẽ nó cứ bám sát gót cậu cả đời? Chẳng lẽ cậu lúc nào cũng phải chịu gánh nặng quá khứ? Chẳng lẽ cậu phải thú tội thật sao? Không hề. Chỉ còn một mảnh bằng chứng chống lại cậu. Chính bức tranh — đó là bằng chứng. Cậu sẽ phá hủy nó. Sao cậu lại giữ nó lâu như vậy? Trước kia nó từng cho cậu niềm vui khi theo dõi nó thay đổi và già đi. Gần đây cậu không thấy niềm vui như vậy nữa. Nó cứ bắt cậu tỉnh dậy giữa đêm. Khi ở xa, cậu cứ sợ là những con mắt khác có thể ngắm nhìn nó. Nó phủ bóng sầu lên các đam mê của cậu. Chỉ cần nhớ đến nó thôi đã là hỏng mất nhiều khoảnh khắc vui sướng. Với cậu, nó giống như lương tâm. Đúng, nó là lương tâm. Cậu phải phá hủy nó.
tr: Ömür boyu yakasına yapışıp kalacak mıydı? Dorian ömür boyu geçmişinin yükünü mü taşıyacaktı? Gerçekten itiraf edecek miydi suçunu? Asla. Ona karşı kullanılabilecek tek bir kanıt kalmıştı: portrenin kendisi; tek kanıt. Dorian ortadan kaldıracaktı onu. Bunca zaman ne diye saklamıştı sanki? Bir zamanlar resmin değişip yaşlanmasını gözlemek ona keyif verirdi. Son zamanlarda bu keyif de kalmamıştı. Geceleri bu resim yüzünden uyuyamamıştı. Evinden uzaklaştığı zaman başka gözler resmi görecek diye dehşete kapılmıştı. Ateşli duygularının üstüne hüzün çökmüştü bu resim yüzünden. Bu resmin salt anısı bile nice keyifli dakikanın tadını kaçırmıştı. Portresi başına vicdan kesilmişti sanki. Evet, vicdanı olmuştu onun. Dorian portreyi ortadan kaldırmalıydı.
es: Pero aquel asesinato..., ¿iba a perseguirlo toda su vida? ¿Siempre tendría que soportar el peso de su pasado? ¿Tendría que confesar? Nunca. No había más que una prueba en contra suya. El cuadro mismo: ésa era la prueba. Lo destruiría. ¿Por qué lo había conservado tanto tiempo? Años atrás le proporcionaba el placer de contemplar cómo cambiaba y se hacía viejo. En los últimos tiempos ese placer había desaparecido. El cuadro le impedía dormir. Cuando salía de viaje, le horrorizaba la posibilidad de que lo contemplasen otros ojos. Teñía de melancolía sus pasiones. Su simple recuerdo echaba a perder muchos momentos de alegría. Había sido para él algo así como su conciencia. Sí. Había sido su conciencia. Lo destruiría.
vi_translation: But this murder — will it follow you all your life? Will you always have to bear the burden of the past? Will you really have to confess? No. There is only one piece of evidence left against you. The painting itself — that is the evidence. You will destroy it. Why have you kept it for so long? It once gave you joy to watch it change and age. Recently, you no longer find such joy. It keeps waking you up in the middle of the night. When you are away, you fear that other eyes might gaze upon it. It casts a shadow of sorrow over your passions. Just thinking about it has ruined many moments of joy. To you, it is like a conscience. Yes, it is a conscience. You must destroy it.
tr_translation: Would it cling to him for life? Would Dorian carry the burden of his past for life? Would he really confess his crime? Never. There was only one piece of evidence left against him: the portrait itself; the only evidence. Dorian would get rid of it. Why had he kept it for so long anyway? Once, he used to take pleasure in watching the picture change and age. Lately, even that pleasure was gone. He couldn't sleep at night because of this picture. When he was away from home, he was terrified that other eyes would see the picture. His fiery emotions were overshadowed by sadness because of this picture. The mere memory of this picture had spoiled many pleasant moments. It was as if the portrait had become his conscience. Yes, it had become his conscience. Dorian had to get rid of the portrait.
es_translation: But that murder..., was it going to haunt him all his life? Would he always have to bear the weight of his past? Should he confess? Never. There was only one piece of evidence against him. The painting itself: that was the evidence. He would destroy it. Why had he kept it for so long? Years ago, it gave him the pleasure of watching it change and grow old. In recent times, that pleasure had disappeared. The painting kept him from sleeping. When he traveled, he was horrified at the possibility of others seeing it. It tinged his passions with melancholy. Its mere memory spoiled many moments of joy. It had been something like his conscience. Yes. It had been his conscience. He would destroy it.

en: When they entered, they found hanging upon the wall a splendid portrait of their master as they had last seen him, in all the wonder of his exquisite youth and beauty. Lying on the floor was a dead man, in evening dress, with a knife in his heart. He was withered, wrinkled, and loathsome of visage. It was not till they had examined the rings that they recognized who it was.
vi: Khi họ vào được rồi thì họ thấy trên tường treo bức chân dung lộng lẫy của ông chủ như họ đã thấy ông lần cuối, cùng tất cả sự diệu kỳ xuân sắc tuyệt vời. Nằm trên sàn là một người chết, mặc dạ phục, với một con dao trong tim. Mặt ông ta tàn tạ, nhăn nheo, ghê tởm. Mãi đến khi xem kỹ những chiếc nhẫn thì họ mới nhận ra ông ta là ai.
tr: İçeri girince duvarda efendilerinin şahane bir portresini buldular: Tıpkı onu en son gördükleri zamanki gibi, benzersiz gençliği ve güzelliğiyle göz kamaştırıyor, soluk kesiyordu. Yerde smokin giymiş, yüreğine bıçak saplanmış ölü bir adam yatmaktaydı. Yüzü buruş buruş, çökük, son derece iğrençti. Ancak yüzüklerini gözden geçirdikleri zaman onun kim olduğunu tanıyabildiler.
es: En el interior encontraron, colgado de la pared, un espléndido retrato de su señor tal como lo habían visto por última vez, en todo el esplendor de su juventud y singular belleza. En el suelo, vestido de etiqueta, y con un cuchillo clavado en el corazón, hallaron el cadáver de un hombre mayor, muy consumido, lleno de arrugas y con un rostro repugnante. Sólo lo reconocieron cuando examinaron las sortijas que llevaba en los dedos.
vi_translation: When they got in, they saw a magnificent portrait of the master hanging on the wall, just as they had seen him last, with all the wonderful springtime beauty. Lying on the floor was a dead man, dressed in evening clothes, with a knife in his heart. His face was haggard, wrinkled, and repulsive. It was not until they examined the rings closely that they recognized who he was.
tr_translation: When they entered, they found a magnificent portrait of their master on the wall: Just as they had last seen him, dazzling with his unique youth and beauty, breathtaking. On the floor lay a man in a tuxedo, with a knife plunged into his heart. His face was wrinkled, sunken, extremely repulsive. It was only when they examined his rings that they could identify who he was.
es_translation: Inside they found, hanging on the wall, a splendid portrait of their lord as they had last seen him, in all the splendor of his youth and singular beauty. On the floor, dressed in formal attire, and with a knife stuck in his heart, they found the corpse of an older man, very emaciated, full of wrinkles, and with a repugnant face. They only recognized him when they examined the rings he wore on his fingers.
